reviews.review_msg: She's the TA for 362 this semester, not helpful at all, ask her question she ignore you and show you how annoying you are. No wonder she became the TA after being a prof from last semester. She can't be the prof for this class, if so, the fun class will become boring...Worst TA and Prof in SFU
The class was okay, but the TA marker was horrible, super hard & picky on the papers~
The exams were sooo hard! I was hoping this class would be interesting, but it wasn't. I found that the prof had no personality when you approach her for help and that she cold.

Ok as a teacher but the exams are out there to trick you.  Do not recommend this course.  You can study all the lectures and readings and still come out of the exam feeling like you don't know anything.

she is good at teaching but her multiple choice exams ar tricky!! the written part is pretty easy... the essays you have to write arent bad.. but the way they mark them is really picky. Overall it was a really interesting class

The most ambiguous exams I have ever seen.  Tries to trick students with M/C answers like " the two of the above are true".  Don't be fooled by the lectures- the exams require memorization of every single word of the readings
No Comments
Even though her exams are very hard, she is very good at explaining the material. She is very sweet and caring with her students and will help you during office hours.

Jennifer's lectures are great and interesting. I appreciate the guest lecturers that she brings in. For a good mark, know lecture slides inside and out (b/c exams are based on ppt) but must still read through readings. Other than the long lectures, I really enjoyed this class.
She was an amazing prof and this was my favourite class at sfu
easy class. non- cumulative tests. iclicker participation every lecture (heads up) gpa booster. relatable to real life

This class was OK. The content is definitely interesting and Dr. Pink does a decent job at covering the topics. The midterm is a bit tricky (some questions are worded odd) and the lectures can get really long. The content can get confusing because there are many exceptions to theories and concepts.

very very helpful understanding & accommodating, greatly values students' opinions, sometimes lectures a bit monotonous & covers a lot of info but still interesting, very constructive & sufficient feedback, very clear on expectations and grading criteria, for exams study slides and textbooks, encourages student participation & gives marks for that.

Jennifer is an amazing professor. She is very passionate about close relationships, and she will definitely inspire anyone interested in this topic. She brings guest lecturers in certain topics, which make it even more interesting. After taking her course, my perspective regarding close relationships drastically changed. Tests are a bit difficult.
Attending lecture is necessary but it's easy to get the participation mark. Exams are MC questions and short answers.
he is really good

Kim is extremely nice, and helpful. Topics were really fun and interesting. However, she sometimes engages too much with her students in class and they should just discuss at office hours. Exams were tricky.  Don't fall behind on readings. Paper was marked hard. See TA to confirm if you have applied the theories correctly to the movie.

Of course those who did well in her class will give her positive feedback. I enjoyed her lectures but when it came to her test questions, I was throughly confused. I found her test questions were ambiguous.
Great class and great prof! Lectures were interesting and relatable to everyday life. Test was pretty easy if you paid attention.

Kim is an excellent lecturer- well-spoken and entertaining. She always makes herself available to students. I really enjoyed this course, it's always a breath of fresh air when a professor is so well-versed in their field that they don't have to refer to their notes when lecturing.

Kim is a fantastic professor. She manages to engage with her students in a 100+ lecture hall, is very fair with her marking and expectations of us. If you go to lecture and really think about the topics (which isn't hard -- we all have close relationships!), the content feels almost intuitive. I appreciate her teaching style and love this class!

Kim is a great lecturer and its not surprising that shes been with the university for over 20yrs. however, the scale is higher for this class. participation is mandatory for 5% overall. shes informative but has tendency to ramble on about material already covered. had a class cancelled bc of snow but was still responsible for material. not cool.
Loved this class! Loved the prof! Would reccomend it to anyone, one of my faveroite classes thus far :)

I love Kim's class! Very engaging and interesting. Shes awesome! No textbook, only journal article which I didnt mind but others did complain about. Multiple choice on her exams are difficult, but written is easy. Participation marks are easy but you have to attend class. I would def take again.

Truthfully, I found her class to be more on the difficult side. She isn't a terrible prof but I wish she used a textbook as opposed to selected readings. Moreover, there's some negativity in the material! Do not be fooled, her exams are ridiculously hard. It was to the point where she had to RECURVE the class because it was too difficult.

Kim is one of my favorite profs at SFU. Lectures are clear, readings are interesting, and she does an amazing job of applying the material to real life. The essay was easy and so were the exams. It's not very hard to get a good grade in this class if you attend all the lectures and do all the readings. Kim is just great!

Kim is awesome. Very interesting, funny, and knowledgeable in the area. Can't say the exams were easy, though. The MC was very tricky and I did terrible on it, while I did really well on the short answer - how is this possible? Overall, a great course, but I do wish she used a textbook other than dozens of journal articles (some 40+ pages long)!

Kim is one of the best profs I have ever had at SFU. She explains everything every clearly and makes a point of integrating student's questions and comments into her lectures. She is very knowledgeable in the area, and her tests are fair. Take her class if you can!!!!

She's really into what she teaches, but it take her FOREVER just to go over one slide or answer one question. Her tests aren't that hard, but you should attend lecture, eventhough she drags them out so long, because she adds in alot of info that isn't in her slides.

Her midterm and final are really poorly done. I recieved extremely low grades on the multiple choice, and A+'s on the short answers. I do not think this demonstrated what I knew in the course because the marks were so extreme. If you are not strong on multiple choice (although I usually am) beware of this course on your GPA.

She's the best prof in sfu..She's nice, funny, helpful and the most important, she's fair. The class was fun, you should go to class when take this course because it's fun! you'll love it..She's way better than the one teach 361

Kim was an awesome professor! Loved the class, its high interest and easy! I got an A+ without putting in too much effort. Very applicable to life and Kim is helpful! I sent her an email and she replied quickly with almost a whole page! Super impressed!
most interesting class i've taken. excellent teacher. makes you interested in the course and think about how it pertains to your own life.
very informative, knowledgeable. enjoyed her class real much!

i actually enjoyed the lecture, however the exams and essays were a different story. Not beacuse they were a bad idea, it is just that i don't like the TA marking everything, i prefer the prof to mark!!!

WOW!! What an awesome class. If you have to take Interpersonal Relationships I suggest that you definitely take it with Bartholomew and not with the alternatives. Paper was interesting and lectures very organized and applicable to life. She is the probably the best prof I've had at SFU.

Kim is an excellent prof...probably the best one ive had thus far for psych. Very interesting topic covered...paper is not too difficult b/c you are just basically analyzing a movie and applying the reltationship concepts learned in class...a very inspiring prof..enjoyed the course
she's not boring to listen to and the material isn't too dry.....worth taking
Excellent prof: clear, articulate, critical, very research minded.  Psyc 362 is a fun course, I enjoyed it.

one of those classes where you can actually apply the stuff to real life.  One of the smartest people I've ever met - she actually came up with theories we have to read about in 100/102!  TAKE THIS CLASS!
enjoyable teacher
Very very good
Well organized lectures, difficult midterm...
she is great! brilliant!

Very engaging lectures. Mastery learning is approachable and effective. Easily the most information I've retained out of any class I've taken. Fun group project and interactive discussions between classmates. I would highly recommend anyone to take her class and I hope mastery learning is more widespread in SFU in the near future.

Amazing professor, very responsive and kind. She's funny and engaging- her lectures are awesome. She's very knowledgeable and teaches well. Her assignments are reasonable but the final had lots of trick questions.

I found this prof to be sort of creepy and overly touchy with me when I asked her to clarify a concept once before class. Just unprofessional and made me uncomfortable. Aside from that though her mastery grading isn't that difficult. You will do well if you just put in some effort towards studying as quizzes are the bulk of your grade.

Although daunting, mastery grading is not as hard as it's made out to be. 
Yuthika is a phenomenal proff and I very much enjoyed 362. I'd highly recommend 362 for all psyc majors.
My one issue with 362 was that one particular TA, was a very harsh grader and gave odd feedback. I know at least 6 people in the class who had the same opinion, bizzare

Mastery quizzes are not hard. Other assignments, while a fair bit of work, are not worth very much so it doesn't matter if you do badly on one of them. I loved the grading scheme, if you put in the effort you will get an A. Her lectures were engaging and interesting and overall she cared a lot about her students. I would definitely recommend.

I don't get the hype about Dr Girme. While she portrays herself as caring and attentive, her interactions with students felt superficial and insincere. I didn't learn anything new and her mastery quizzes were not helpful for learning.

She is a great prof and enjoyed lectures. I didnt like her grading scale (you need 10/12, 11/12 for partial to full marks). Each mastery quiz is worth 7% but a 2500 word paper is worth 10%? Lastly I wish she laid her ground rules for mastery quizzes cause she had to change the whole final exam cause people took pictures. I still recommend though

Yuthika is a lovely prof, very passionate. But her grading is absolutely atrocious. You have 3 tries to "master" her quizzes (which means you are only allowed to make 1 mistake or you'll get a grade of 0). My TA was a tough grader for no reason. Overall, TAKE THE QUIZZES SERIOUSLY! nothing else matters in the class tbh.

I don't find her mastery quizzes useful or helpful for our learning. You get 3 tries on the quizzes. If you do bad on the first quiz, no problem! Just memorize the answer because 60% of the questions are from the first quiz. If you get 10/12, that's 50% and 11/12 or 12/12 is 100%. I don't like her grading scale
Really really amazing prof! I would def recommend taking one of her classes if you have a chance! A true gem, if you have any questions feel free to ask her!

Yuthika was one of my all time favourite profs. I took her course remotely and she created podcasts called Merlot with my Beau with her husband Steve. They were really engaging and featured other distinguished professors from around the world. Course evaluation was mainly quizzes and discussions on Canvas. She was very accommodating despite covid

Even though I didn't get the best grade (probably due to the pandemic), Professor Grime's relationship course is definitely one you should take (either as an elective or for psychology credits). All the concepts will be from the slides, though you'll need to read articles as they will appear on the test. The lectures are fun and full of activities

I took Psyc 391 & 362 with Girme. She is super fun and obviously puts lots of effort into her lectures. Lecture slides are well organized and clear, and readings are available online, and usually somewhat covered in class. Exams are hard, must know diagrams from slides in detail. Class participation is mandatory, iclicker ?'s every class.
Dr. Girme is an awesome prof, and the class is super interesting. She has a great sense of humor, does a great job of explaining theories and contextualizing everything. Highly recommend!

Yuthika is the best prof I've ever taken a class with. I found myself going to lecture because I actually enjoyed the way she presented the material, and not just to get participation marks. Her tests are based solely on the lecture notes, so make sure you're clear on the concepts in lecture & you'll do amazing on the midterm and final.
Yuthika is an amazing prof and her lectures are very interesting and engaging.

Dr. Girme is a great lecturer, the class project is engaging and the tests are relatively challenging, but reasonable if you pay attention in class and do the readings. I would strongly recommend taking PSYC362!

Had her for relationship psychology. Amazing prof who's considerate and genuine and funny. Her exams are pretty simple as long as you read all the slides and attend lectures. Is very clear and concise in her teaching as well.

Yuthika was an amazing prof! She's probably one of the best lecturer's I have ever had at SFU and her content is extremely clear and concise. She also makes the lectures super interesting and is funny as hell. She's also super helpful when certain concepts are not well understand. Overall, she's dope.

This was the most difficult online course I have taken at SFU. In addition to the weekly quizzes, weekly group assignments were required in essay style. The TAs were also difficult markers and didn't provide clear feedback upon meeting them for a regrade. Don't take this course if you're looking for a GPA booster or an elective, it's not worth it.
yeah no... save urself from this class. take something else

The format of this course was easy, no final or midterm, but the module quizzes and assignments were almost impossible to do well on. Quiz questions reference one obscure thing from the textbook. Grading criteria was super confusing, and the TA marked super hard. Wouldn't take again.

This professor was unclear of what she wanted. Lectures were obviously recorded awhile back and barely helped for what was actually on the exam. Exams involved you to input information that was barely mentioned throughout the course. Very hard to contact her so the TA is your best bet for anything.

Do not take this course unless you desperately need to, at least with Cobb. The lectures and readings were not integrated well, and the midterms and final were so far removed from the material we learned in class. Study the questions she gives for the practice assessments! That's the only solid advice I can give for this course.

The prof is not the main contact but the TA is also unresponsive to emails and doesn't put a lot of effort in caring about students. Lecture videos are a bit messy it seems to be reused for several semesters, no lecture slides, midterm questions are hard and some not course related. Movie paper assignment unclear and confusing.

Lecture materials are very disorganized. Exams are extremely hard especially because it doesn't draw from the current lecture materials. The movie paper assignment instruction is disorganized. She reuses the same lecture videos every semester and doesn't even revise it. I should've used the elective grade system for this course! AVOID AT ALL COST!

1)  The questions from exams don't even test the knowledge from the course, they are ridiculously hard even when you study.
2) This prof is not accommodating at all if you are taking it online. If you have technical issues that interfere she simply responds it was your fault to begin with and does not allow any room to make up.

Interesting material but poor execution! I'm sure Becky is a nice person, but she did not care about the course. Video audio cuts off almost every week but nothing is done about it. Exams included old questions on material we weren't assigned to review. Exam questions are quite hard, specific, and wordy, and the 1 hr limit is tight! DON'T TAKE IT!

Do no take this course to ruin your GPA (if you care for it). Buy books and learn thr course contents by yourself. The time limit for each exam is insufficient. The professor presents different contradictory findings in lecture and then ask super specific questions. Sometimes the questions are out of materials and assign long readings too.

Unideal class structure. The exams are timed to be completed in an hour. The questions are mercilessly specific. The quality of the lectures are not good. She goes over so many points and expects you to memorize specific details of readings and studies. You barely have time to think that long. Very inaccessible for asking for help.

I took this class online and was eager about the content, which was rather interesting however I highly disliked the course overall. The exam structure was terrible, barely enough time to complete it and the questions are very specific and trivial. The course structure overall online is not ideal.

I strongly disliked this course. There was no communication between the course supervisor, TA, and students. I studied very hard for every exam and then nearly cried because I would do poorly anyways. The only reason I am not below 60% is because of the paper and participation mark. Exam questions are very very difficult.

Exam questions are based on specific results of random studies she doesn't mention. There was zero communication or interaction from the proof, and the TA knew nothing. It's hard to be self-directed/teach yourself when half of the video lectures do not work. Terrible.

Most of the time she won't question you about the things she says in lecture, but will pick one irrelevant study in a 45 page chapter and ask you about their results. Easily the worst exams I've ever taken, they're nearly impossible to study for unless you've got a photographic memory. Avoid her class if you can, it's a miserable experience.

Horrible. It's 2021, lecture recordings shouldn't be so low quality. You essentially teach yourself everything and she shows you videos of Friends while rambling about nothing. 2 midterms, a final, and a final paper you need to peer review. Exams are a crapshoot, she asks about random studies mentioned in class for 5 seconds. Seriously, avoid!!

The worst class ive ever taken at SFU, and coming from a 5th year student that says a lot. The most confusing exams, don't let the course name fool you into thinking this will be a good course. Prof also is super confusing, perhaps this is her first time teaching, not sure.
Avoid at any cost. All the information from the lectures is so uncleared since she had no idea how to teach everything to you. Take it, and you waste credits for P grade.

As mentioned in other comments, this is not quite a hard course but the prof has no idea how to teach properly. Lectures are broken and make few contributions to the comprehension of the material. I mean you can have a pass grade on it if you are interested in the topic otherwise avoid.

When I took it online, there were several videos posted by her. However it seems that the TA was the one handling the course 99% of the time. I personally didn't like the online version because it was very disengaging. Can't really say much about Prof Cobb though because she wasn't there at all.

The exams are almost impossible to do well on. They ask you questions about information that was mentioned in a random sentence in the textbook that doesn't at all draw on concepts of the course. The time limit for the exam is also ridiculous as it gives you no time to even think about the answer as the questions take forever to read themselves.

Course was interesting but the exams are ridiculous, you can fully know every concept and theory but if you don't know the names of who did a certain study off a random page of the textbook you're screwed. Instead of questioning on concepts she questions on random small things that were barely talked about.
One of my least favourite classes I've taken at SFU. The course consisted of confusing lectures followed by exams that were based on minuscule details. I would not take a course with this prof again.

The course material is really interesting, but the course is poorly organized. The prof does not respond to emails. Some of the online lectures on canvas just stopped intermittently while playing (No sound suddenly, I guess she made a mistake when she was recording her lecture). Lecture slides are pretty vague and difficult to study for exams.

She doesnt seem to understand anything about theory. You have to listen to her yatter on about useless stats which dont make sense. Also she kept talking about how female victimization isnt real, I found that to be offensive.

I took this class as an elective thinking that it would be easy. The exams are SO SUBJECTIVE!!!!! Regardless of whether or not I studied I would do bad on exams. The only easy thing about this class was the paper - which was actually reasonably marked. Thank god it got scaled (because her averages are so bad!!!!)
She's a nice lady but she gets frustrated easily and comes across passive aggressive at times.
i don't think she is not personable. when i took her class, she asked me twice if my paper is going okay. just because she deals with student very professionally doesn't mean she isn't caring

I think it's really unfair to say she is not personable. Just because she does not confirm the warm stereotype for female professor does not mean she doesn't care about her students. A male professor who deals with students professionally would not have received such comment. she is very approachable and willing to help her students.

I really enjoyed the content of this course but found the prof very unapproachable. She seemed unhappy to talk to the students although I know that's not how she hoped to come across. Questions were encouraged in class, but I think most people were afraid to speak up!

I found the textbook way more interesting than the course itself. The lectures were lengthy, material covered within them very repetitious and boring. I found the multiple choice questions on the exams very confusing and choices very ambiguous, so knowing the real answers didn't seem to help much. The term paper was fairly easy.

interesting class. attendance required because of iclicker participation, but other than that it's 2 exams & a paper. paper is based on a movie- extremely easy & quite fun to do! exams are difficult. mc & sa, which is marked hard! make sure to study lecture & textbook

I agree with everyone else. I have never taken a test where I needed to memorize every study done and who conducted it. Tests were impossible to do well (even if you memorized) and there was more than one right answer. Papers were hard and boring. I was interested in this class before I took it but I found Rebecca very uninviting and strict.

Lectures are digitized, so you can listen to them at home if you decide not to go to class. Her lecture style is clear, interesting, and easy to follow. She presents the material well, and explains concepts thoroughly. Her movie essay assignment is a little repetitive and boring to write, but if you follow instructions you'll do fine.

The lecture material is easy to understand and pretty interesting, but the exams are a little more difficult, and nit-picky especially considering she doesn't go into a lot of depth in class. Make sure you do the readings and answer questions according to what her opinion would be.
She seems nice and timid at first but she is actually very strict, and picky.
Good teaching ability, but tests were a little hard.  Kind of picky questions

Not impressed. Not impressed at all. I knew that material thru and thru, and that final exam was RIDICULOUS. she wanted us to reference studies? the questions were so specific that not even she could have aced that. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!

Well, I actually really enjoyed this class. This prof is awesome, her lectures were organized and interesting - NOT boring at all! If you find her lecures boring, then perhaps you are in the wrong class. Her exams were VERY FAIR. Anyone who complains about her exams clearly didn't study enough.
She was passive aggressive. She snappssssssss @ students @ office hrz. Her lecz r boring & dry.

Dr. Cobb lives with her cat (a bonafide love expert!) Perhaps she now has a human love interest - highly doubt it. She seems to have a  cynical outlook on relationships. She also appears to hide behind her PhD status. Passive-aggressive comes to mind. Save your money! Listen to conventional wisdom. Nothing surprising emerges from her classes.

huh. I was actually impressed at how WELL written the exams were. She is very organized and really knows her stuff. She's current with what's happening in the field and teaches the material in a simple and clear way. Everything's pretty straightforward and interesting too.

Rebecca's exams are really unfair because many of the questions depend on subjective opinion rather than objective facts.  There could be more than one answer to many of her questions, and there is no "best" answer.  Even if you memorized everything, you could still do poorly on her exams if your opinions are different than hers.
Rebecca is very narrow minded, and she gets upset when students express opinions that are different from her own opinions.

This class is strictly about relationships. The text was very easy to read, almost like a novel. The other required readings (articles) are not too bad, you only need to get the general idea. The exams are not about memorization but UNDERSTANDING the material.. overall a great and enjoyable course... better than evolutionary psyc imho.
Being in her class is like being in an Oprah audience...too touchy feely!!!
No Comments
Rebecca is an interesting character.  Not that bad, but not that good either.  She is a bit controlling, but she does try to understand people.

Really this course is all about relationships.  Rebecca's exams are different, aome of the written questions didn't seem to have answers that corresponded to the material.  Paper assignment was interesting and easy, see the TA if you have trouble. Otherwise the course was weighted in the end, so everyone did better than expected. Interesting course
Rebecca is a very touchy-feely person, so she really does not think critically or rationally, and is thus driven too much by emotion. She needs to think more, and put her personal feelings aside.
No Comments

Really has a non-constructive approach as if she wants the students to do bad. Never clear on the grading criteria and so not friendly. Do not take her class, take it later with someone else if possible so that you will end up with much more knowledge and better grades
